"He was on fire," Hornets coach Paul Silas said of Allen Iverson , who fell eight points shy of Michael Jordan 's NBA playoff record set exactly 17 years ago in a double-overtime loss at Boston. Anytime a guy like that is on fire, there's very Kobe Bryant you can do except to take the ball out of his hands. It's right up there with Michael Beasley 's 63. He just had a great night. The NBA saw some superlative performances over the opening weekend of the playoffs, but the best came in the last game.
